basics.name: Chase Sharp
basics.label: Technical Support Specialist
basics.summary: A multifaceted tech specialist with a passion for solving puzzles.

courses: Cisco Networking I, II, and III

education.studyType: Bachelors in Science - 134 Credits Completed -- Completed Courses for a Minor in Mathematics
courses: Computer Programming and Linear Data structure

work.name: The Sandwich Odyssey
work.summary: Worked and maintained an industrial sized range. As the main sandwich shop on a high volume street, cooked around 10+lbs of meat per hour daily . Help setup, run, and breakdown multiple catering events every year. Diagnose and repair a Cisco Router or work computer running Windows 11 to restore online ordering capability.

work.name: T-Mobile
work.summary: As an Account Associate at T-Mobile I was on the front lines of calls for Customer Support. Most calls were regarding account statements, and billing questions. In addition to these calls, I would assist customers by configuring cellphones, routers, and ESIM profiles.

work.name: Vaughns Ventures
work.summary: As a Retail Associate at Vaughns Ventures main my responsibilites involved sales, customer retention, and technical support. As a small retail business, their sales depended on the loyalty of their regulars.

skills.name: Cisco Networking
keywords: Ability to configure Cisco Devices through the Cisco IOS CLI
Expert knowledge of TCP/IP, BGP, EIGRP, and OSPF
Extensive practice with the OSI model
Able to configure, administrate, and repair both Windows and Linux Operating systems.

skills.name: Support Ticket Software
keywords: Experience working within Service Level Agreements

projects.name: Stake
projects.summary: A vampire themed Rogue-like FPS. Explode enemies with gruesome physics based combat.

projects.name: Pentest Lab
projects.summary: I've created a variety of pentesting labs throughout my life. The project provides gives an example setup of what I might use to practice exploits on preconfigured machines. It is a step by step guide on how to set up one of these labs, and how to make sure that it is contained locally. These labs help me prepare for both defense and offense in a live enviroment setting.

projects.summary: A vampire themed Rogue-like FPS. Explode enemies with gruesome physics based combat.

projects.name: GameJam: Fish & Ships
projects.summary: 2D ship shooter with physics based movement

projects.name: USBank CTF
projects.summary: A day long CTF competition hosted by USBank. Various schools across the nation competed on this challenge. I placed first amongst all the students competing at WCC.

projects.name: GameJam Game: Wonderland
projects.summary: A short zelda inspired game featuring WASD-movement and basic melee combat.

projects.name: National Collegiate Cyber Defense Competition - Pacific Rim
projects.summary: An annual cyber defence competition with sponsers and representatives from the FBI, CIA, and private defense contractors. In order to prepare for the competition we met twice weekly throughout the school year and specialized in specific administrative roles. In 2016 we placed 2nd in the state.

projects.name: PicoCTF 2014
projects.summary: The first CTF competition I ever competed in. I was able to exectute a buffer overflow attack, though I did not fully understand how it worked. It set me on a lifetime mission of learning.
